topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Post-Alpha Release Build 22: Configuring SR-IOV

body.p: A SR-IOV Ethernet interface is a physical PCI Ethernet NIC that implements hardware-based virtualization mechanisms to expose multiple virtual network interfaces that can be used by one or more virtual machines simultaneously.

ol.li: Log into the KVM region controller-0 node with root privileges.

Identify the compute node with Niantic NIC and configure the node. In this example, eth8 of mem17-compute0 is used as SR-IOV NIC.system host-list system host-lock mem17-compute0 system host-if-modify -nt pci-sriov -N 16 -p physnet1 mem17-compute0 eth8 system host-unlock mem17-compute0
Once the compute node comes back online, login to the compute node and validate if VFs are visible:ip link | grep VF

Create neutron network, a direct port and launch VM using the port. For example, here VLAN 810 neutron net-create hrushi-sriov-net-810 --provider:network_type vlan --provider:segmentation_id 810 --provider:physical_network physnet1 neutron subnet-create --name sriov-subnet-810 hrushi-sriov-net-810 31.31.31.0/24 --disable-dhcp --no-gateway --allocation-pool start=31.31.31.100,end=31.31.31.200 neutron port-create 125e6f3c-e1aa-49c8-a20a-0ede67d9b6fe --vnic-type direct nova boot hrushi-sriov-fixed --image wrl --flavor 2 --nic port-id=abd5b42a-e8f5-4297-91ba-707c01195cc7

body.p: After successfully launching a VM, ensure that the VF is tagged with VLAN ID 810ip link | grep vfFor example,vf 15 MAC aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff, vlan 810, spoof checking on
